086/**
087 * A utility class providing useful operations related to Java {@link
088 * Type}s.
089 *
090 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
091 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
092 */
093public final class JavaTypes {
094
095
096  /*
097   * Static fields.
098   */
099
100
101  private static final Type[] EMPTY_TYPE_ARRAY = new Type[0];
102
103  /**
104   * An immutable {@link Map} of Java wrapper {@linkplain Class
105   * classes} indexed by their primitive equivalents.
106   */
107  public static final Map<Type, Class<?>> boxedTypes =
108    Map.of(boolean.class, Boolean.class,
109           byte.class,    Byte.class,
110           char.class,    Character.class,
111           double.class,  Double.class,
112           float.class,   Float.class,
113           int.class,     Integer.class,
114           long.class,    Long.class,
115           short.class,   Short.class,
116           void.class,    Void.class);
117
118
119  /*
120   * Constructors.
121   */
122
123
124  private JavaTypes() {
125    super();
126  }
127
128
129  /*
130   * Static methods.
131   */
132
133
134  /**
135   * Returns the supplied {@link Type} if it is not a {@link Class} or
136   * if it is {@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() not primitive}, or a
137   * {@linkplain #boxedTypes boxed type} representing it.
138   *
139   * @param type the {@link Type}; must not be {@code null}
140   *
141   * @return a boxed representation of the supplied {@link Type}, or
142   * the {@link Type} itself
143   *
144   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
145   *
146   * @idempotency This method is deterministic, but not necessarily
147   * idempotent.
148   *
149   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
150   * threads.
151   *
152   * @see #boxedTypes
153   */
154  public static final Type box(final Type type) {
155    if (type == void.class) {
156      // This is such a ridiculously common case we avoid the map lookup
157      return Void.class;
158    } else if (type == int.class) {
159      // This is such a ridiculously common case we avoid the map lookup
160      return Integer.class;
161    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c && c.isPrimitive()) {
162      return boxedTypes.get(c);
163    } else {
164      return type;
165    }
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
170   * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
171   * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
172   * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
173   * the {@link CovariantSemantics} class.
174   *
175   * <p>This method calls {@link CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type,
176   * Type)} with the supplied arguments and returns the result.</p>
177   *
178   * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
179   * not be {@code null}
180   *
181   * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
182   * not be {@code null}
183   *
184   * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the type
185   * modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable to a
186   * reference bearing the type modeled by the {@link
187   * CovariantSemantics} class
188   *
189   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
190   * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
191   *
192   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
193   *
194   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
195   * threads.
196   *
197   * @see CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
198   */
199  @Convenience
200  public static final boolean assignable(final Type receiverType, final Type payloadType) {
201    return CovariantSemantics.INSTANCE.assignable(receiverType, payloadType);
202  }
203
204  /**
205   * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
206   * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
207   * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
208   * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
209   * the {@link CovariantSemantics} class.
210   *
211   * <p>This method calls {@link CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type,
212   * Type, boolean)} with the supplied arguments and returns the
213   * result.</p>
214   *
215   * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
216   * not be {@code null}
217   *
218   * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
219   * not be {@code null}
220   *
221   * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
222   *
223   * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the type
224   * modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable to a
225   * reference bearing the type modeled by the {@link
226   * CovariantSemantics} class
227   *
228   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
229   * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
230   *
231   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
232   *
233   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
234   * threads.
235   *
236   * @see CovariantSemantics#assignable(Type, Type, boolean)
237   */
238  @Convenience
239  public static final boolean assignable(final Type receiverType, final Type payloadType, final boolean box) {
240    return CovariantSemantics.INSTANCE.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, box);
241  }

243  /**
244   * Returns a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}.
245   *
246   * @return a {@link Type} array with a length of {@code 0}
247   *
248   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
249   *
250   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic
251   *
252   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
253   * threads.
254   */
255  public static final Type[] emptyTypeArray() {
256    return EMPTY_TYPE_ARRAY;
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Returns the <em>direct supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
261   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
262   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
263   * TypeVariable}.
264   *
265   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type
266   * itself.</p>
267   *
268   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
269   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
270   * implementation.</p>
271   *
272   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
273   * null}
274   *
275   * @return a {@link Collection} of the direct supertypes of the
276   * supplied {@code type}; never {@code null}
277   *
278   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
279   *
280   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
281   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
282   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
283   *
284   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
285   *
286   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
287   *
288   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
289   * threads.
290   */
291  public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Type type) {
292    if (Objects.requireNonNull(type) instanceof Class<?> c) {
293      return directSupertypes(c);
294    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
295      return directSupertypes(p);
296    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
297      return directSupertypes(g);
298    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
299      return directSupertypes(tv);
300    } else {
301      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
302    }
303  }
304
305  /**
306   * Returns the <em>direct supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
307   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
308   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
309   * TypeVariable}.
310   *
311   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type do not include the type
312   * itself.</p>
313   *
314   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
315   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
316   * implementation.</p>
317   *
318   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
319   * null}
320   *
321   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
322   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
323   * must not be {@code null}
324   *
325   * @return a {@link Collection} of the direct supertypes of the
326   * supplied {@code type}; never {@code null}
327   *
328   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code type} or {@code
329   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}.
330   *
331   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
332   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
333   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
334   *
335   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
336   *
337   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
338   *
339   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
340   * threads.
341   */
342  public static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Type type,
343                                                                  final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
344    final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes = directSupertypes(type);
345    if (directSupertypes.isEmpty()) {
346      return List.of();
347    }
348    final ArrayList<Type> c = new ArrayList<>(directSupertypes.size());
349    for (final Type ds : directSupertypes) {
350      if (acceptancePredicate.test(ds)) {
351        c.add(ds);
352      }
353    }
354    c.trimToSize();
355    return c.isEmpty() ? List.of() : Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
356  }
357
358  static final <T> boolean acceptAll(final T type) {
359    return true;
360  }
361
362  private static final Collection<? extends Type> directSupertypes(final Class<?> c) {
363    if (c == Object.class) {
364      return List.of();
365    } else if (c.isPrimitive()) {
366      // 4.10.1. Subtyping among Primitive Types
367      //
368      // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
369      // among the primitive types:
370      //
371      // double >₁ float
372      //
373      // float >₁ long
374      //
375      // long >₁ int
376      //
377      // int >₁ char
378      //
379      // int >₁ short
380      //
381      // short >₁ byte
382      //
383      // [We skip all this.]
384      return List.of();
385    } else {
386      final ArrayList<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
387      final Class<?> componentType = c.getComponentType();
388      if (componentType == null) {
389        final Type[] parameters = c.getTypeParameters();
390        if (parameters.length > 0) {
391          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
392          //
393          // […]
394          //
395          // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
396          // F₁,…,Fₙ (𝑛 > 0), the direct supertypes of the [this]
397          // raw type C (§4.8) are all of the following:
398          //
399          // The erasure (§4.6) of the direct superclass type of C, if
400          // C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
401          //
402          // The erasure of the direct superinterface types of C.
403          //
404          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
405          // superinterface types.
406          final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = c.getSuperclass(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
407          if (directSuperclassTypeErasure != null) {
408            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassTypeErasure);
409          }
410          final Class<?>[] directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures = c.getInterfaces(); // let the JDK do the erasure for us
411          if (directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures.length > 0) {
412            for (final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure : directSuperinterfaceTypeErasures) {
413              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure);
414            }
415          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
416            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
417          }
418        } else {
419          // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
420          //
421          // Given a non-generic class or interface C, the direct
422          // supertypes of the type of C are all of the following:
423          //
424          // The direct superclass type of C (§8.1.4), if C is a class.
425          //
426          // The direct superinterface types of C (§8.1.5, §9.1.3).
427          //
428          // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
429          // superinterface types (§9.1.3).
430          final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass(); // let the JDK construct what may be either a Class or a ParameterizedType
431          if (directSuperclassType != null) {
432            assert (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType;
433            directSupertypes.add(directSuperclassType);
434          }
435          final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces(); // let the JDK construct what may be either Class or ParameterizedType instances
436          if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
437            for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
438              assert (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?>) || (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType) : "Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType;
439              directSupertypes.add(directSuperinterfaceType);
440            }
441          } else if (c.isInterface()) {
442            directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
443          }
444        }
445      } else {
446        // 4.10.3. Subtyping among Array Types
447        //
448        // The following rules define the direct supertype relation
449        // among array types:
450        //
451        // If S and T are both reference types, then S[] >₁ T[] iff
452        // S >₁ T.
453        //
454        // Object >₁ Object[]
455        //
456        // Cloneable >₁ Object[]
457        //
458        // java.io.Serializable >₁ Object[]
459        //
460        // If P is a primitive type, then:
461        //
462        // Object >₁ P[]
463        //
464        // Cloneable >₁ P[]
465        //
466        // java.io.Serializable >₁ P[]
467        if (componentType == Object.class || componentType.isPrimitive()) {
468          // Object[] or, say, int[]
469          directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
470          directSupertypes.add(Cloneable.class);
471          directSupertypes.add(Serializable.class);
472        } else {
473          // Reference type (which could be a Class or a ParameterizedType).
474          for (final Type componentTypeDirectSupertype : directSupertypes(componentType)) {
475            directSupertypes.add(array(componentTypeDirectSupertype));
476          }
477        }
478      }
479      directSupertypes.trimToSize();
480      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
481    }
482  }
483
484  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final ParameterizedType p) {
485    final ArrayList<Type> directSupertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
486    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
487    //
488    // […]
489    //
490    // Given a generic class or interface C with type parameters
491    // F₁,…,Fₙ (𝑛 > 0), the direct supertypes of the parameterized
492    // type C<T₁,…,Tₙ>, where each of Tᵢ (1 ≤ 𝑖 ≤ 𝑛) is a type, are
493    // all of the following:
494    //
495    // The substitution [F₁:=T₁,…,Fₙ:=Tₙ] applied to the direct
496    // superclass type of C, if C is a class [i.e. not an interface].
497    //
498    // The substitution [F₁:=T₁,…,Fₙ:=Tₙ] applied to the direct
499    // superinterface types of C.
500    //
501    // C<S₁,…,Sₙ>, where Sᵢ contains Tᵢ (1 ≤ 𝑖 ≤ 𝑛) (§4.5.1) [we're
502    // going to skip this].
503    //
504    // The type Object, if C is an interface with no direct
505    // superinterface types.
506    //
507    // The raw type C.
508    final Class<?> c = erase(p.getRawType());
509    final Type[] typeArguments = p.getActualTypeArguments();
510    final Type directSuperclassType = c.getGenericSuperclass();
511    if (directSuperclassType != null) {
512      if (directSuperclassType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
513        final Class<?> directSuperclassTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
514        assert directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
515        assert typeArguments.length == directSuperclassTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
516        directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperclassTypeErasure, typeArguments));
517      } else if (directSuperclassType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericClass) {
518        assert nonGenericClass.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
519        directSupertypes.add(nonGenericClass);
520      } else {
521        throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperclassType: " + directSuperclassType);
522      }
523    }
524    final Type[] directSuperinterfaceTypes = c.getGenericInterfaces();
525    if (directSuperinterfaceTypes.length > 0) {
526      for (final Type directSuperinterfaceType : directSuperinterfaceTypes) {
527        if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof ParameterizedType dst) {
528          final Class<?> directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure = erase(dst.getRawType());
529          assert directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length > 0 : "Unexpected empty type parameters";
530          assert typeArguments.length == directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure.getTypeParameters().length;
531          directSupertypes.add(new DefaultParameterizedType(dst.getOwnerType(), directSuperinterfaceTypeErasure, typeArguments));
532        } else if (directSuperinterfaceType instanceof Class<?> nonGenericInterface) {
533          assert nonGenericInterface.getTypeParameters().length == 0;
534          directSupertypes.add(nonGenericInterface);
535        } else {
536          throw new AssertionError("Unexpected directSuperinterfaceType: " + directSuperinterfaceType);
537        }
538      }
539    } else if (c.isInterface()) {
540      directSupertypes.add(Object.class);
541    }
542    directSupertypes.add(c);
543    directSupertypes.trimToSize();
544    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(directSupertypes);
545  }
546
547  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final GenericArrayType g) {
548    final Collection<? extends Type> genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes = directSupertypes(g.getGenericComponentType());
549    final Collection<Type> returnValue = new ArrayList<>(genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes.size());
550    for (final Type ds : genericComponentTypeDirectSupertypes) {
551      returnValue.add(array(ds));
552    }
553    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(returnValue);
554  }
555
556  private static final Collection<Type> directSupertypes(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
557    // 4.10.2. Subtyping among Class and Interface Types
558    //
559    // […]
560    //
561    // The direct supertypes of a type variable are the types listed
562    // in its bound.
563    return List.of(tv.getBounds());
564  }
565
566  /**
567   * Returns the <em>supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
568   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
569   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
570   * TypeVariable}.
571   *
572   * <p><strong>The supertypes of a type include the type
573   * itself.</strong></p>
574   *
575   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
576   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
577   * implementation.</p>
578   *
579   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
580   * null}
581   *
582   * @return a {@link Collection} of the supertypes of the supplied
583   * {@code type}; never {@code null}
584   *
585   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}.
586   *
587   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
588   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
589   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
590   *
591   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
592   *
593   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
594   *
595   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
596   * threads.
597   */
598  public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type) {
599    return supertypes0(type, new HashSet<>()::add);
600  }
601
602  /**
603   * Returns the <em>supertypes</em> of the supplied {@link
604   * Type}, provided that it is either a {@link Class}, a {@link
605   * ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType} or a {@link
606   * TypeVariable}.
607   *
608   * <p><strong>The supertypes of a type include the type
609   * itself.</strong></p>
610   *
611   * <p>The returned {@link Collection} will contain no duplicate
612   * elements but is not guaranteed to be a {@link Set}
613   * implementation.</p>
614   *
615   * @param type the {@link Type} to introspect; must not be {@code
616   * null}
617   *
618   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
619   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
620   * must not be {@code null}
621   *
622   * @return a {@link Collection} of the supertypes of the supplied
623   * {@code type}; never {@code null}
624   *
625   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code type} or {@code
626   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}.
627   *
628   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code type} is not a
629   * {@link Class} and not a {@link ParameterizedType} and not a
630   * {@link GenericArrayType} and not a {@link TypeVariable}
631   *
632   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
633   *
634   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
635   *
636   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
637   * threads.
638   */
639  public static final Collection<Type> supertypes(final Type type, final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
640    final ArrayList<Type> c = new ArrayList<>(11);
641    for (final Type st : supertypes(type)) {
642      if (acceptancePredicate.test(st)) {
643        c.add(st);
644      }
645    }
646    c.trimToSize();
647    return c.isEmpty() ? List.of() : Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
648  }
649
650  private static final Collection<Type> supertypes0(final Type type, final Predicate<? super JavaType> unseen) {
651    if (unseen.test(JavaType.of(type))) {
652      final ArrayList<Type> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(11);
653      supertypes.add(type); // reflexive
654      for (final Type ds : directSupertypes(type)) {
655        supertypes.addAll(supertypes0(ds, unseen)); // transitive/recursive
656      }
657      supertypes.trimToSize();
658      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(supertypes);
659    } else {
660      return List.of();
661    }
662  }
663
664  /**
665   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
666   * {@code sub}.
667   *
668   * <p>This method obeys the <a
669   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10"
670   * target="_parent">subtyping rules from the Java Language
671   * Specification</a> with the following exceptions:</p>
672   *
673   * <ul>
674   *
675   * <li><a
676   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1"
677   * target="_parent">Containing types</a> are discarded when
678   * calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.</li>
679   *
680   * <li>{@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() Primitive types} have no
681   * supertypes.</li>
682   *
683   * </ul>
684   *
685   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
686   *
687   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
688   *
689   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
690   * {@code sub}
691   *
692   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code
693   * null}
694   *
695   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
696   *
697   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
698   * threads.
699   *
700   * @see #supertypes(Type)
701   */
702  public static final boolean supertype(final Type sup, final Type sub) {
703    return supertype(sup, sub, null);
704  }
705
706  /**
707   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
708   * {@code sub}.
709   *
710   * <p>This method obeys the <a
711   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10"
712   * target="_parent">subtyping rules from the Java Language
713   * Specification</a> with the following exceptions:</p>
714   *
715   * <ul>
716   *
717   * <li><a
718   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1"
719   * target="_parent">Containing types</a> are discarded when
720   * calculating the supertypes of a parameterized type.</li>
721   *
722   * <li>{@linkplain Class#isPrimitive() Primitive types} have no
723   * supertypes.</li>
724   *
725   * </ul>
726   *
727   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
728   *
729   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
730   *
731   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling which
732   * supertypes are considered in this method's calculation; may be
733   * {@code null} in which case all supertypes will be considered
734   *
735   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code sup} is a supertype of
736   * {@code sub}
737   *
738   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code sup} or {@code
739   * sub} is {@code null}
740   *
741   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
742   *
743   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
744   * threads.
745   *
746   * @see #supertypes(Type, Predicate)
747   */
748  public static final boolean supertype(final Type sup, final Type sub, Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
749    // Is sup a supertype of sub?
750    Objects.requireNonNull(sup, "sup");
751    Objects.requireNonNull(sub, "sub");
752    final boolean acceptAll;
753    if (acceptancePredicate == null) {
754      acceptancePredicate = JavaTypes::acceptAll;
755      acceptAll = true;
756    } else {
757      acceptAll = acceptancePredicate == (Predicate<? super Type>)JavaTypes::acceptAll;
758    }
759    if (acceptAll || acceptancePredicate.test(sup) && acceptancePredicate.test(sub)) {
760      if (equals(sup, sub)) {
761        return true;
762      } else if (acceptAll && sup instanceof Class<?> supC && sub instanceof Class<?> subC) {
763        // Easy optimization
764        return supC.isAssignableFrom(subC);
765      } else {
766        for (final Type supertype : supertypes(sub, acceptancePredicate)) {
767          if (equals(supertype, sup)) {
768            return true;
769          }
770        }
771      }
772    }
773    return false;
774  }
775
776  private static final Type array(final Type type) {
777    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-10.html#jls-10.1
778    // 10.1 Array Types
779    // …
780    // The element type of an array may be any type, whether
781    // primitive or reference.
782    // …
783    // [That rules out wildcards, but nothing else.]
784    if (type == null) {
785      throw new NullPointerException("type");
786    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
787      return c.arrayType();
788    } else if (!(type instanceof WildcardType)) {
789      return new DefaultGenericArrayType(type);
790    } else {
791      throw new IllegalArgumentException("type: " + toString(type));
792    }
793  }
794
795  static final boolean isReferenceType(final Type type) {
796    // Wildcards are ruled out by the BNF in
797    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1
798    return !(type == null || type instanceof WildcardType || (type instanceof Class<?> c && c.isPrimitive()));
799  }
800
801  /**
802   * Returns the type erasure for the supplied {@link Type} according
803   * to <a
804   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6"
805   * target="_parent">the rules of the Java Language
806   * Specification, section 4.6</a>.
807   *
808   * <ul>
809   *
810   * <li>If {@code null} is supplied, {@code null} is returned.</li>
811   *
812   * <li>If a {@link Class} is supplied, the {@link Class} is returned.</li>
813   *
814   * <li>If a {@link ParameterizedType} is supplied, the result of
815   * invoking {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
816   * ParameterizedType#getRawType() raw type} is returned.</li>
817   *
818   * <li>If a {@link GenericArrayType} is supplied, the result of
819   * invoking {@link Object#getClass()} on an invocation of {@link
820   * java.lang.reflect.Array#newInstance(Class, int)} with the return
821   * value of an invocation of {@link #erase(Type)} on its {@linkplain
822   * GenericArrayType#getGenericComponentType() generic component
823   * type} and {@code 0} as its arguments is returned.</li>
824   *
825   * <li>If a {@link TypeVariable} is supplied, the result of invoking
826   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
827   * TypeVariable#getBounds() first (leftmost) bound}</strong> is
828   * returned (if it has one) or {@link Object Object.class} if it
829   * does not.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
830   *
831   * <li>If a {@link WildcardType} is supplied, the result of invoking
832   * {@link #erase(Type)} <strong>on its {@linkplain
833   * WildcardType#getUpperBounds() first upper bound}</strong> is
834   * returned.  <strong>Any other bounds are ignored.</strong></li>
835   *
836   * <li>If any other {@link Type} implementation is supplied, {@code
837   * null} is returned.</li>
838   *
839   * </ul>
840   *
841   * @param type the {@link Type} for which the corresponding type
842   * erasure is to be returned; may be {@code null} in which case
843   * {@code null} will be returned
844   *
845   * @return a {@link Class}, or {@code null} if a suitable {@link
846   * Class}-typed type erasure could not be determined, indicating
847   * that the type erasure is the supplied {@link Type} itself
848   *
849   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
850   *
851   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple
852   * threads.
853   *
854   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
855   */
856  public static final Class<?> erase(final Type type) {
857    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
858    // 4.6. Type Erasure
859    //
860    // Type erasure is a mapping from types (possibly including
861    // parameterized types and type variables) to types (that are
862    // never parameterized types or type variables). We write |T| for
863    // the erasure of type T. The erasure mapping is defined as
864    // follows:
865    //
866    // The erasure of a parameterized type (§4.5) G<T1,…,Tn> is |G|.
867    //
868    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is |T|.C.
869    //
870    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[].
871    //
872    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
873    // leftmost bound.
874    //
875    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself.
876    if (type == null) {
877      return null;
878    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
879      return erase(c);
880    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
881      return erase(p);
882    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
883      return erase(g);
884    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
885      return erase(tv);
886    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
887      return erase(w);
888    } else {
889      return null;
890    }
891  }
892
893  private static final Class<?> erase(final Class<?> type) {
894    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
895    // …
896    // The erasure of a nested type T.C is
897    // |T|.C. [Class.getDeclaringClass() returns an already erased
898    // type.]
899    //
900    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [A Class that is an
901    // array has a Class as its component type, and that is already
902    // erased.]
903    // …
904    // The erasure of every other type is the type itself. [So in all
905    // cases we can just return the supplied Class<?>.]
906    return type;
907  }
908
909  private static final Class<?> erase(final ParameterizedType type) {
910    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
911    // …
912    // The erasure of a parameterized type (§4.5) G<T1,…,Tₙ> is |G|
913    // [|G| means the erasure of G, i.e. the erasure of
914    // type.getRawType()].
915    return erase(type.getRawType());
916  }
917
918  private static final Class<?> erase(final GenericArrayType type) {
919    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
920    //
921    // The erasure of an array type T[] is |T|[]. [|T| means the
922    // erasure of T. We erase the genericComponentType() and use
923    // Class#arrayType() to find the "normal" array class for the
924    // erasure.]
925    final Class<?> componentType = erase(type.getGenericComponentType());
926    if (componentType == null) {
927      return null;
928    } else {
929      return componentType.arrayType();
930    }
931  }
932
933  private static final Class<?> erase(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
934    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
935    //
936    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
937    // leftmost bound. [In the case of a TypeVariable<?> that returns
938    // multiple bounds, we know they will start with a class, not an
939    // interface and not a type variable.]
940    final Type[] bounds = type.getBounds();
941    return bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
942  }
943
944  private static final Class<?> erase(final WildcardType type) {
945    // https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se11/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6
946    //
947    // The erasure of a type variable (§4.4) is the erasure of its
948    // leftmost bound.  [WildcardTypes aren't really in the JLS per se
949    // but they behave like type variables. Only upper bounds will
950    // matter here.]
951    final Type[] bounds = type.getUpperBounds();
952    return bounds != null && bounds.length > 0 ? erase(bounds[0]) : Object.class;
953  }
954
955  /**
956   * Tests two {@link Type}s for equality in a manner that is
957   * independent of their implementations.
958   *
959   * @param type0 the first {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
960   *
961   * @param type1 the second {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
962   *
963   * @return {@code true} if the two {@link Type}s are equal; {@code
964   * false} otherwise
965   *
966   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
967   * threads.
968   *
969   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
970   */
971  public static final boolean equals(final Type type0, final Type type1) {
972    if (type0 == null) {
973      return type1 == null;
974    } else if (type1 == null) {
975      return false;
976    } else if (type0 == type1) {
977      return true;
978    } else if (type0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
979      return type1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
980    } else if (type0 instanceof ParameterizedType p0) {
981      return type1 instanceof ParameterizedType p1 && equals(p0, p1);
982    } else if (type0 instanceof GenericArrayType g0) {
983      return type1 instanceof GenericArrayType g1 && equals(g0, g1);
984    } else if (type0 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv0) {
985      return type1 instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv1 && equals(tv0, tv1);
986    } else if (type0 instanceof WildcardType w0) {
987      return type1 instanceof WildcardType w1 && equals(w0, w1);
988    } else {
989      return Objects.equals(type0, type1);
990    }
991  }
992
993  private static final boolean equals(final Type[] ts0, final Type[] ts1) {
994    if (ts0 == null) {
995      return ts1 == null;
996    } else if (ts1 == null) {
997      return false;
998    } else if (ts0 == ts1) {
999      return true;
1000    } else if (ts0.length == ts1.length) {
1001      for (final Type t0 : ts0) {
1002        for (final Type t1 : ts1) {
1003          if (!equals(t0, t1)) {
1004            return false;
1005          }
1006        }
1007      }
1008      return true;
1009    } else {
1010      return false;
1011    }
1012  }
1013
1014  private static final boolean equals(final Class<?> c0, final Class<?> c1) {
1015    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
1016  }
1017
1018  private static final boolean equals(final ParameterizedType pt0, final ParameterizedType pt1) {
1019    if (pt0 == null) {
1020      return pt1 == null;
1021    } else if (pt1 == null) {
1022      return false;
1023    } else if (pt0 == pt1) {
1024      return true;
1025    } else {
1026      return
1027        equals(pt0.getOwnerType(), pt1.getOwnerType()) &&
1028        equals(pt0.getRawType(), pt1.getRawType()) &&
1029        equals(pt0.getActualTypeArguments(), pt1.getActualTypeArguments());
1030    }
1031  }
1032
1033  private static final boolean equals(final GenericArrayType ga0, final GenericArrayType ga1) {
1034    if (ga0 == null) {
1035      return ga1 == null;
1036    } else if (ga1 == null) {
1037      return false;
1038    } else if (ga0 == ga1) {
1039      return true;
1040    } else {
1041      return equals(ga0.getGenericComponentType(), ga1.getGenericComponentType());
1042    }
1043  }
1044
1045  private static final boolean equals(final TypeVariable<?> tv0, final TypeVariable<?> tv1) {
1046    if (tv0 == null) {
1047      return tv1 == null;
1048    } else if (tv1 == null) {
1049      return false;
1050    } else if (tv0 == tv1) {
1051      return true;
1052    } else {
1053      return
1054        equals(tv0.getGenericDeclaration(), tv1.getGenericDeclaration()) &&
1055        Objects.equals(tv0.getName(), tv1.getName());
1056    }
1057  }
1058
1059  private static final boolean equals(final GenericDeclaration gd0, final GenericDeclaration gd1) {
1060    if (gd0 == null) {
1061      return gd1 == null;
1062    } else if (gd1 == null) {
1063      return false;
1064    } else if (gd0 == gd1) {
1065      return true;
1066    } else if (gd0 instanceof Class<?> c0) {
1067      return gd1 instanceof Class<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
1068    } else if (gd0 instanceof Executable e0) {
1069      return gd1 instanceof Executable e1 && equals(e0, e1);
1070    } else {
1071      return Objects.equals(gd0, gd1);
1072    }
1073  }
1074
1075  private static final boolean equals(final Executable e0, final Executable e1) {
1076    if (e0 == null) {
1077      return e1 == null;
1078    } else if (e1 == null) {
1079      return false;
1080    } else if (e0 == e1) {
1081      return true;
1082    } else if (e0 instanceof Constructor<?> c0) {
1083      return e1 instanceof Constructor<?> c1 && equals(c0, c1);
1084    } else if (e0 instanceof Method m0) {
1085      return e1 instanceof Method m1 && equals(m0, m1);
1086    } else {
1087      return Objects.equals(e0, e1);
1088    }
1089  }
1090
1091  private static final boolean equals(final Constructor<?> c0, final Constructor<?> c1) {
1092    return Objects.equals(c0, c1);
1093  }
1094
1095  private static final boolean equals(final Method m0, final Method m1) {
1096    return Objects.equals(m0, m1);
1097  }
1098
1099  private static final boolean equals(final WildcardType w0, final WildcardType w1) {
1100    if (w0 == null) {
1101      return w1 == null;
1102    } else if (w1 == null) {
1103      return false;
1104    } else if (w0 == w1) {
1105      return true;
1106    } else {
1107      return
1108        equals(w0.getLowerBounds(), w1.getLowerBounds()) &&
1109        equals(w0.getUpperBounds(), w1.getUpperBounds());
1110    }
1111  }
1112
1113  /**
1114   * Computes and returns a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type} independent of
1115   * its implementation.
1116   *
1117   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in
1118   * which case {@code 0} will be returned
1119   *
1120   * @return a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}
1121   *
1122   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1123   * threads.
1124   *
1125   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1126   */
1127  public static final int hashCode(final Type type) {
1128    if (type == null) {
1129      return 0;
1130    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
1131      return hashCode(c);
1132    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1133      return hashCode(p);
1134    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1135      return hashCode(g);
1136    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1137      return hashCode(tv);
1138    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1139      return hashCode(w);
1140    } else {
1141      return type.hashCode();
1142    }
1143  }
1144
1145  private static final int hashCode(final Class<?> type) {
1146    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1147  }
1148
1149  private static final int hashCode(final ParameterizedType type) {
1150    if (type == null) {
1151      return 0;
1152    } else {
1153      return Arrays.hashCode(type.getActualTypeArguments()) ^ hashCode(type.getOwnerType()) ^ hashCode(type.getRawType());
1154    }
1155  }
1156
1157  private static final int hashCode(final GenericArrayType type) {
1158    return type == null ? 0 : Objects.hashCode(type.getGenericComponentType());
1159  }
1160
1161  private static final int hashCode(final TypeVariable<?> type) {
1162    return type == null ? 0 : type.hashCode();
1163  }
1164
1165  private static final int hashCode(final WildcardType type) {
1166    return type == null ? 0 : Arrays.hashCode(type.getUpperBounds()) ^ Arrays.hashCode(type.getLowerBounds());
1167  }
1168
1169  /**
1170   * Returns a {@link String} representation of the supplied {@link
1171   * Type} that is independent of its implementation.
1172   *
1173   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
1174   *
1175   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; may be {@code null} in which
1176   * case "{@code null}" will be returned
1177   *
1178   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of the
1179   * supplied {@link Type}
1180   *
1181   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1182   *
1183   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1184   * threads.
1185   *
1186   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1187   */
1188  public static final String toString(final Type type) {
1189    if (type == null) {
1190      return "null";
1191    } else if (type instanceof Class<?> c) {
1192      return toString(c);
1193    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1194      return toString(p);
1195    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1196      return toString(g);
1197    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1198      return toString(tv);
1199    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1200      return toString(w);
1201    } else {
1202      return type.getTypeName();
1203    }
1204  }
1205
1206  private static final String toString(final Class<?> c) {
1207    return c == null ? "null" : c.getTypeName();
1208  }
1209
1210  private static final String toString(final ParameterizedType ptype) {
1211    if (ptype == null) {
1212      return "null";
1213    } else {
1214      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1215      final Type ownerType = ptype.getOwnerType();
1216      if (ownerType == null) {
1217        sb.append(toString(ptype.getRawType()));
1218      } else {
1219        sb.append(toString(ownerType)).append("$");
1220        final Type rawType = ptype.getRawType();
1221        if (ownerType instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1222          sb.append(toString(rawType).replace(toString(p.getRawType()) + "$", ""));
1223        } else if (rawType instanceof Class<?> c) {
1224          sb.append(c.getSimpleName());
1225        } else {
1226          sb.append(toString(rawType));
1227        }
1228      }
1229      final Type[] actualTypeArguments = ptype.getActualTypeArguments();
1230      if (actualTypeArguments != null && actualTypeArguments.length > 0) {
1231        final StringJoiner stringJoiner = new StringJoiner(", ", "<", ">");
1232        stringJoiner.setEmptyValue("");
1233        for (final Type actualTypeArgument : actualTypeArguments) {
1234          stringJoiner.add(toString(actualTypeArgument));
1235        }
1236        sb.append(stringJoiner.toString());
1237      }
1238      return sb.toString();
1239    }
1240  }
1241
1242  private static final String toString(final GenericArrayType gatype) {
1243    if (gatype == null) {
1244      return "null";
1245    } else {
1246      return toString(gatype.getGenericComponentType()) + "[]";
1247    }
1248  }
1249
1250  private static final String toString(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1251    return tv == null ? "null" : tv.getName();
1252  }
1253
1254  private static final String toString(final WildcardType wc) {
1255    if (wc == null) {
1256      return "null";
1257    } else {
1258      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("?");
1259      Type[] bounds = wc.getLowerBounds();
1260      if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0) {
1261        // Upper bounds only.
1262        bounds = wc.getUpperBounds();
1263        if (bounds == null || bounds.length <= 0 || Object.class.equals(bounds[0])) {
1264          bounds = null;
1265        } else {
1266          sb.append(" extends ");
1267        }
1268      } else {
1269        // Lower bounds only.
1270        sb.append(" super ");
1271      }
1272      if (bounds != null) {
1273        assert bounds.length > 0;
1274        final StringJoiner sj = new StringJoiner(" & ");
1275        for (final Type bound: bounds) {
1276          sj.add(String.valueOf(toString(bound)));
1277        }
1278        sb.append(sj.toString());
1279      }
1280      return sb.toString();
1281    }
1282  }
1283
1284  /**
1285   * Returns an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1286   * ConstantDesc}.
1287   *
1288   * @param constantDesc the {@link ConstantDesc} to represent; may be
1289   * {@code null}; if {@code null}, then an {@link Optional}
1290   * consisting of {@link java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs#NULL} will
1291   * be returned
1292   *
1293   * @return an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1294   * ConstantDesc}; never {@code null}; never {@linkplain
1295   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1296   *
1297   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1298   *
1299   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1300   *
1301   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1302   * threads.
1303   */
1304  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1305    return constantDesc == null ? Optional.of(NULL) : Optional.of(constantDesc);
1306  }
1307
1308  /**
1309   * Returns an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1310   * Constable}.
1311   *
1312   * @param constable the {@link Constable} to represent; may be
1313   * {@code null}; if {@code null}, then an {@link Optional}
1314   * consisting of {@link java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs#NULL} will
1315   * be returned
1316   *
1317   * @return an {@link Optional} representing the supplied {@link
1318   * Constable}; never {@code null}; possibly {@linkplain
1319   * Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1320   *
1321   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1322   *
1323   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1324   *
1325   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1326   * threads.
1327   */
1328  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Constable constable) {
1329    return constable == null ? Optional.of(NULL) : constable.describeConstable();
1330  }
1331
1332  /**
1333   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1334   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link Type}, or
1335   * an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>} if
1336   * there is no such descriptor.
1337   *
1338   * @param type the {@link Type} in question; must be either {@code
1339   * null}, a {@link ConstantDesc} itself, a {@link Constable}, a
1340   * {@link ParameterizedType}, a {@link GenericArrayType}, a {@link
1341   * TypeVariable} or a {@link WildcardType}
1342   *
1343   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1344   * null}
1345   *
1346   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1347   *
1348   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1349   *
1350   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1351   * threads.
1352   *
1353   * @see Constable
1354   */
1355  public static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Type type) {
1356    if (type == null) {
1357      return Optional.of(NULL);
1358    } else if (type instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1359      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1360    } else if (type instanceof Constable constable) {
1361      return describeConstable(constable); // includes Class<?>
1362    } else if (type instanceof ParameterizedType p) {
1363      return describeConstable(p);
1364    } else if (type instanceof GenericArrayType g) {
1365      return describeConstable(g);
1366    } else if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1367      return describeConstable(tv);
1368    } else if (type instanceof WildcardType w) {
1369      return describeConstable(w);
1370    } else {
1371      return Optional.empty();
1372    }
1373  }
1374
1375  /**
1376   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1377   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1378   * ParameterizedType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1379   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1380   *
1381   * @param ptype the {@link ParameterizedType} in question; may be
1382   * {@code null}
1383   *
1384   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1385   * null}
1386   *
1387   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1388   *
1389   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1390   *
1391   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1392   * threads.
1393   *
1394   * @see Constable
1395   */
1396  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final ParameterizedType ptype) {
1397    if (ptype == null) {
1398      return Optional.of(NULL);
1399    } else if (ptype instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1400      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1401    } else if (ptype instanceof Constable constable) {
1402      return describeConstable(constable);
1403    } else {
1404      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> ownerType = describeConstable(ptype.getOwnerType());
1405      if (ownerType.isPresent()) {
1406        final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> rawType = describeConstable(ptype.getRawType());
1407        if (rawType.isPresent()) {
1408          final Type[] actualTypeArguments = ptype.getActualTypeArguments();
1409          final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = actualTypeArguments.length + 3;
1410          final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1411          bsmInvokeArguments[0] =
1412            MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
1413                                           CD_Type,
1414                                           CD_Type,
1415                                           CD_Type.arrayType());
1416          bsmInvokeArguments[1] = ownerType.orElseThrow();
1417          bsmInvokeArguments[2] = rawType.orElseThrow();
1418          for (int i = 3; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1419            final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(actualTypeArguments[i - 3]);
1420            if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1421              return Optional.empty();
1422            }
1423            bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1424          }
1425          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1426                                                         DEFAULT_NAME,
1427                                                         CD_DefaultParameterizedType,
1428                                                         bsmInvokeArguments));
1429        }
1430      }
1431      return Optional.empty();
1432    }
1433  }
1434
1435  /**
1436   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1437   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1438   * GenericArrayType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1439   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1440   *
1441   * @param g the {@link GenericArrayType} in question; may be
1442   * {@code null}
1443   *
1444   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1445   * null}
1446   *
1447   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1448   *
1449   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1450   *
1451   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1452   * threads.
1453   *
1454   * @see Constable
1455   */
1456  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final GenericArrayType g) {
1457    if (g == null) {
1458      return Optional.of(NULL);
1459    } else if (g instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1460      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1461    } else if (g instanceof Constable c) {
1462      return describeConstable(c);
1463    } else {
1464      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> genericComponentType = describeConstable(g.getGenericComponentType());
1465      if (genericComponentType.isPresent()) {
1466        return
1467          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1468                                                  DEFAULT_NAME,
1469                                                  CD_DefaultGenericArrayType,
1470                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_DefaultGenericArrayType,
1471                                                                                 CD_Type),
1472                                                  genericComponentType.orElseThrow()));
1473      }
1474      return Optional.empty();
1475    }
1476  }
1477
1478  /**
1479   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1480   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1481   * TypeVariable}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1482   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1483   *
1484   * @param tv the {@link TypeVariable} in question; may be {@code
1485   * null}
1486   *
1487   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1488   * null}
1489   *
1490   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1491   *
1492   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1493   *
1494   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1495   * threads.
1496   *
1497   * @see Constable
1498   */
1499  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final TypeVariable<?> tv) {
1500    if (tv == null) {
1501      return Optional.of(NULL);
1502    } else if (tv instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1503      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1504    } else if (tv instanceof Constable constable) {
1505      return describeConstable(constable);
1506    } else {
1507      final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> gd = describeConstable(tv.getGenericDeclaration());
1508      if (gd.isPresent()) {
1509        final String name = tv.getName();
1510        return
1511          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1512                                                  name,
1513                                                  CD_TypeVariable,
1514                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
1515                                                                            Bootstraps.CD_Bootstraps,
1516                                                                            "getTypeVariable",
1517                                                                            MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_TypeVariable,
1518                                                                                              CD_GenericDeclaration,
1519                                                                                              CD_String)),
1520                                                  gd.orElseThrow(),
1521                                                  name));
1522      }
1523      return Optional.empty();
1524    }
1525  }
1526
1527  /**
1528   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1529   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1530   * WildcardType}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1531   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1532   *
1533   * @param w the {@link WildcardType} in question; may be {@code
1534   * null}
1535   *
1536   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1537   * null}
1538   *
1539   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1540   *
1541   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1542   *
1543   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1544   * threads.
1545   *
1546   * @see Constable
1547   */
1548  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final WildcardType w) {
1549    if (w == null) {
1550      return Optional.of(NULL);
1551    } else if (w instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1552      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1553    } else if (w instanceof Constable c) {
1554      return describeConstable(c);
1555    } else {
1556      final Type[] lowerBounds = w.getLowerBounds();
1557      if (lowerBounds.length <= 0) {
1558        final Type[] upperBounds = w.getUpperBounds();
1559        if (upperBounds.length <= 0 || (upperBounds.length == 1 && upperBounds[0] == Object.class)) {
1560          // Unbounded.
1561          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_GET_STATIC_FINAL,
1562                                                         "INSTANCE",
1563                                                         CD_WildcardType,
1564                                                         CD_UnboundedWildcardType));
1565        } else {
1566          // Upper bounded (extends).
1567          final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = upperBounds.length + 1;
1568          final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1569          bsmInvokeArguments[0] = MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_UpperBoundedWildcardType, CD_Type.arrayType());
1570          for (int i = 1; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1571            final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(upperBounds[i - 1]);
1572            if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1573              return Optional.empty();
1574            }
1575            bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1576          }
1577          return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1578                                                         DEFAULT_NAME,
1579                                                         CD_UpperBoundedWildcardType,
1580                                                         bsmInvokeArguments));
1581        }
1582      } else {
1583        // Lower bounded.
1584        final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = lowerBounds.length + 1;
1585        final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
1586        bsmInvokeArguments[0] = MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_LowerBoundedWildcardType, CD_Type.arrayType());
1587        for (int i = 1; i < bsmInvokeArgumentsLength; i++) {
1588          final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> arg = describeConstable(lowerBounds[i - 1]);
1589          if (arg.isEmpty()) {
1590            return Optional.empty();
1591          }
1592          bsmInvokeArguments[i] = arg.orElseThrow();
1593        }
1594        return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1595                                                       DEFAULT_NAME,
1596                                                       CD_LowerBoundedWildcardType,
1597                                                       bsmInvokeArguments));
1598      }
1599    }
1600  }
1601
1602  /**
1603   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1604   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1605   * GenericDeclaration}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1606   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1607   *
1608   * @param gd the {@link GenericDeclaration} in question; must be
1609   * either {@code null}, a {@link Class}, a {@link Constructor} or a
1610   * {@link Method}
1611   *
1612   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1613   * null}
1614   *
1615   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1616   *
1617   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1618   *
1619   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1620   * threads.
1621   *
1622   * @see Constable
1623   */
1624  static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final GenericDeclaration gd) {
1625    if (gd instanceof ConstantDesc constantDesc) {
1626      return describeConstable(constantDesc);
1627    } else if (gd instanceof Constable constable) {
1628      // Includes Class<?>
1629      return describeConstable(constable);
1630    } else if (gd instanceof Constructor<?> c) {
1631      return describeConstable(c);
1632    } else if (gd instanceof Method m) {
1633      return describeConstable(m);
1634    } else {
1635      return Optional.empty();
1636    }
1637  }
1638
1639  /**
1640   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1641   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link
1642   * Constructor}, or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty
1643   * <code>Optional</code>} if there is no such descriptor.
1644   *
1645   * @param constructor the {@link Constructor} in question; may be
1646   * {@code null}
1647   *
1648   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1649   * null}
1650   *
1651   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1652   *
1653   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1654   *
1655   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1656   * threads.
1657   *
1658   * @see Constable
1659   */
1660  private static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Constructor<?> constructor) {
1661    Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> c = null;
1662    try {
1663      c = MethodHandles.lookup().unreflectConstructor(constructor).describeConstable();
1664    } catch (final IllegalAccessException illegalAccessException) {
1665      c = Optional.empty();
1666    }
1667    if (c != null && c.isPresent()) {
1668      return
1669        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1670                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
1671                                                CD_Constructor,
1672                                                DMHD_REFLECT_AS,
1673                                                CD_Constructor,
1674                                                c.orElseThrow()));
1675    }
1676    return Optional.empty();
1677  }
1678
1679  /**
1680   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing the nominal descriptor in
1681   * the form of a {@link ConstantDesc} for the supplied {@link Method},
1682   * or an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>}
1683   * if there is no such descriptor.
1684   *
1685   * @param method the {@link Method} in question; may be {@code null}
1686   *
1687   * @return an {@link Optional} as described above; never {@code
1688   * null}
1689   *
1690   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1691   *
1692   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1693   *
1694   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1695   * threads.
1696   *
1697   * @see Constable
1698   */
1699  static final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable(final Method method) {
1700    Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> m = null;
1701    try {
1702      m = MethodHandles.lookup().unreflect(method).describeConstable();
1703    } catch (final IllegalAccessException illegalAccessException) {
1704      m = Optional.empty();
1705    }
1706    if (m != null && m.isPresent()) {
1707      return
1708        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1709                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
1710                                                CD_Method,
1711                                                DMHD_REFLECT_AS,
1712                                                CD_Method,
1713                                                m.orElseThrow()));
1714    }
1715    return Optional.empty();
1716  }
